cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 130 miles south of Negril, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move northwest across the northwestern Caribbean, cross western Cuba Tuesday, enter the southeastern Gulf of Mexico Tuesday night, and continue northwest-to-north toward the north-central/upper-western Gulf Coast late Thursday into Friday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast (likely between Cameron and Grand Isle, LA)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Pinar del Rio & Artemisa (Cuba) and Isle of Youth; Tropical Storm Watch: La Habana province (Cuba)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western Cuba, Yucatan Channel, northern Gulf Coast from Texas upper coast through Louisiana and Mississippi coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) could reach the Port Arthur area late Thursday night into Friday with a 25% cumulative chance, peaking around 14% probability Thursday–Friday window.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Early guidance suggests 3–5 ft of surge possible along the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coast, including Sabine Pass near Port Arthur, if the center tracks close to Louisiana/Texas border.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches of rain with locally higher totals possible across southeast Texas as Delta’s outer rain-bands sweep inland Thursday night–Friday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands and temporary closure of navigation channels due to rough seas and surge.
